name: UI designer
purpose: Create functional and accessible user interface designs that meets the needs of the users and the client
accountabilities: Designing the interaction between the user and the application
Designing the visual presentation of the overall layouts and the individual components
Building prototypes for evaluation and exposure
Creating documentation in the appropriate format

name: Content designer
purpose: Make products easy to use through meaningful copy
accountabilities: Writing macro- and microcopy for products
Documenting copy and writing choices appropriately
Questioning 'story' of the product from a content perspective

name: System designer
purpose: Shape a solid and consistent structural groundwork upon which a user interface can be built
accountabilities: Analysing and designing the information environment (IA)
Analysing and design the user’s journey through that environment
Creating visual representations for evaluation and exposure (DoGo-Maps, User Story Maps, Customer Journey Maps…)

name: Product strategist
purpose: Envision a clear and research-based strategy for the product
accountabilities: Familiarising yourself with the client’s strategical goals (internal context) and research insights (external context)
Distilling contextual knowledge into project OKRs, strategical personas and user stories
Facilitating strategical decision-making for the client
